sentence.Network_en: For the first and only time Grant's self-control snapped.
sentence.Network_cn: 生平第一次也是唯一的一次，格兰特失控了。

sentence.Network_en: His self-control, reserve and aloofness were almost inhuman.
sentence.Network_cn: 他自制、矜持和冷漠得几乎有些不近人情。

sentence.Network_en: I began to wish I'd shown more self-control.
sentence.Network_cn: 我开始想当时若是更自制一些就好了。

entry.def: Self-control is the ability to not show your feelings or not do the things that your feelings make you want to do.

example.ex: His self-control, reserve and aloofness were almost inhuman...
example.tran: 他自制、矜持和冷漠得几乎有些不近人情。

example.ex: I began to wish  I'd shown more self-control.
example.tran: 我开始想当时若是更自制一些就好了。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of denying yourself; controlling your impulses
2. the trait of resolutely controlling your own behavior

sentences.en: His face remained impassive, so strong was his self-control.
sentences.cn: 他依然是面无表情，自控能力是如此之强。

sentences.en: He showed great self-control when they were teasing him.
sentences.cn: 别人开他玩笑,他表现出极大的自制。

sentences.en: It took all the self-control he had not to lose his temper.
sentences.cn: 他极力克制才忍住没发脾气。
